summary: This document is a chain of emails between FBI agents in February 2021 discussing the coordination of an interview with a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails focus on scheduling, logistics, and connecting the victim with a trauma-focused therapist.

persons.name: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: An FBI agent from the New York Field Office, part of the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, coordinating an interview with an Epstein victim and discussing therapist referrals.

connections.person1: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office
connections.description: Both are FBI agents working on the Epstein case, with SA being copied on an email for coordination purposes.

events.title: Scheduling of victim interview
events.description: Final coordination for an interview with an Epstein victim scheduled for the morning of February 25, 2021.
personsInvolved: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office

events.title: Discussion of victim's needs
events.description: An FBI agent reaches out regarding an Epstein victim who has resurfaced and is asking for a trauma-focused therapist, and seeks to schedule an interview.
personsInvolved: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office

keyFacts: FBI agents were actively coordinating an interview with an Epstein victim as recently as February 2021.
The victim had previously been assisted by the FBI and had resurfaced, specifically requesting a trauma-focused therapist.
The communication shows ongoing investigative activity and victim support efforts years after Epstein's death.
The emails reference logistical challenges, such as agent availability and the victim's location relative to FBI offices.
The document is part of a series, with a reference to another file (EFTA00154172).
